title: Are Wolf's marks even worth going for anymore?
body:
Kindred has been my favourite jungler since her/their release, and she has been in some strong and weak spots in her life.

The main part of early game kindred is tracking wolfs marks through the jungle. But recently that seems like a less and less viable thing to do.

She isn't strong atm, and the champions who are strong (and popular), completely ruin her (Lee, Kha, Hec etc). So duelling it out with the enemy jungler is basically impossible for her in the early stages of the game.

Plus with the new marking system introduced a patch or two ago (marks spawn more regularly and last for a shorter time), she spends most of her time chasing marks (that you know are gone even before you even go for them). And loses out on farming and ganking time.

Getting the mark, recalling, and then returning to the jungle, is just enough time for the next mark to spawn (50 seconds), its not enough time to get a camp or two in between.
And if you don't go for your marks as soon as they spawn, you don't have any  chance of getting them.
If the enemy jungler is even half competent, they **will** get your marks far before you do. (she has the lowest movement speed in the game, Lee has the highest, and she has to travel twice the distance to get to them. Do the maths.)
Its just luck if the mark happens to spawn in a camp thats on the opposite side of the map to Lee.

So you are in a cycle of forever chasing marks (that most of the time are either gone, or have a 5/1 Lee Sin waiting next to them.) so not only do you miss tons of farm by wandering aimlessly in the jungle, but not getting the mark puts you further and further behind.

_________

So my question is:
Is it even worth going for Wolf's jungle marks anymore? (except scuttle and dragon)
Is it better to just mark laners and spend your time ganking and farming instead? Completely ignoring the marks in the jungle.

If anyone who is really good with kindred, or is a higher elo, could give me some advice on this, that would be awesome.

Im not slow going for my marks, I time when I get them, and I know what camps are the ones likely to be marked next, and time myself to be in at least the river when the next mark spawns. But every Kindred game for the last week, has been me just running into empty camps, or into Lee. I either die, or escape without a mark, recall/respawn, get back into the jungle seconds before the next mark comes up, and the whole process repeats.

What should I be doing?
Thanks

replies.body:
I take it more as an opportunistic approach. You can either get marks through getting the camps (which carries all the usual inherent risks but with the added bonus of rewarding the opposition for being more proactive in their counter-jungling), or through successful ganks.

The few Kindred games I've played, I've taken Wolf marks if and only if the opportunity presents itself, rather than going out of my way for it.

In itself it can be a kind of counter-jungling - if the enemy Lee thinks you're coming for it and is waiting for you, it gives you a really good opportunity to gank the opposite side of the map.

Thats really good advice, thanks!

She still needs marks to be effective though, so if the opportunity doesn't arise, it does put you in a bit of a tight spot, that would be my only concern.
